PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: For both polymers , obvious diffraction peaks were detected before the samples were annealed , which indicates that some degree of crystallinity has been formed at room temperature.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| crystallinity |
| room temperature |

In this paragraph, the two "Property Name" entities are "crystallinity" and "room temperature." "Crystallinity" refers to the state or quality of being crystalline, and "room temperature" is the standard temperature of a typical room, often assumed to be around 20-25 degrees Celsius. These entities are mentioned in the context of the formation of some degree of crystallinity at room temperature in the polymers before annealing.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| crystallinity |

In this paragraph, the only clear "Material Property" entity is "crystallinity." While "room temperature" is a well-defined concept, it is not a material property in this context. Instead, it is a reference point for the temperature at which crystallinity has been formed. Therefore, it is not included in the table.

* "room temperature" is identified as a Property Value entity because it refers to the temperature at which the polymers were annealed, which is a property of the experimental conditions.
